website_summaries.verdict: A great option for those who like to work outdoors but hate the thought of chemical mosquito repellents.
pros: Roomy size, so you can easily wear it with a wide-brimmed hat
Folds up small, so you can fit it in your pocket when not using it
cons: The mesh is larger, so you won't be able to keep out no-see-ums or smaller mosquitos

customer_reviews.title: Roomy, not tight
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of these and one of the cheaper ones. The size of this mosquito head net allows it to be put over a hat with a brim. Also the material drapes down so it's not right around your neck. So i purchased two more for our trip to the Everglades. It doesn't take up much space so its easy to stick in your pocket if you aren't sure you'll need it and feel silly wearing it. Once the mosquitoes start swarming you won't feel silly at all.
customer_reviews.author: Paloma Sail

customer_reviews.title: Here in Alaska we have the worst bugs I've ever seen (even for Alaska)
customer_reviews.text: Finally a headnet I can see through even in sunlight! Here in Alaska we have the worst bugs I've ever seen (even for Alaska). Though it does not keep all the no-see-ums out, it does keep most of them out--I don't believe there is any way to keep them all out; this is the best I've found. And it completely excludes the whitesocks, numerous kinds of mosquitos and other flies.
customer_reviews.author: CCP

customer_reviews.title: Black flies be gone
customer_reviews.text: Black flies in Maine & NY are not getting in my eyes, nose, or mouth! I wear it over a bugs away hat with a brim. If the wind picks up & the flies die down, I lift the net & roll ir over the brim, always ready to pull it back down when we change course!
customer_reviews.author: Sue Ellen Lantelme

customer_reviews.title: Yeah, it really is "Premium"
customer_reviews.text: I boughtand, while it works just fine, it is on the small side. This product is considerably larger and I can comfortably wear it over my wide-brimmed hat. It has an actual draw string at the bottom (not just elastic) and a quality toggle (grabber thingy to hold drawstring closed). It comes in a cute little storage bag with its own drawstring and toggle.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Bushman

customer_reviews.title: Must have for Gnat season
customer_reviews.text: The gnats are sooooooo bad right now in Florida and working out side is awful so i ordered 2 of these so we can work in the horse pastures without screaming for relief from the Gnats .... Oh My .... These are sooooooo wonderful !!!! No bugs !!!!! A tad heavy but to thin and they would just shred and soft and they fit over my husbands big Panama hat . They work beautifully and i see getting a few seasons out of them .Very well made and they have a draw string to adjust the opening .
customer_reviews.author: Dusty

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR NOSEEUMS/biting black flies/ midges
customer_reviews.text: OMG NOT FOR biting black flies/midges/ noseeums despite advertising such. Large mesh holes. This one is in lower part of picture, upper one is noseeum mesh. Good for visibility for running away from biters though!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Necessary and useful!
customer_reviews.text: It has been a horrible summer for biting gnats in Minnesota. In the evenings, add the mosquitos to the list of pests. The head nets have allowed me to walk the trails and garden rather than have cabin fever in the summer. I wear mine over a regular baseball cap, and it works fine, but a wider brim hat creates more distance between your face and the bugs. I wasn't sure I would want to wear this when it arrived because I was afraid it would block vision, etc. but it is remarkably easy to see through and keeps the bugs away. Worth every penny to be able to be outside.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa M. Luedtke

customer_reviews.title: Hot, heavy, bulky and black!
customer_reviews.text: Hot, heavy and bulky. The dark black weave makes it look even worse-I know nets are not a fashion statement, but this is painful physically and visually.
customer_reviews.author: D.D

customer_reviews.title: Keeps those annoying biters away!
customer_reviews.text: I live in the south, and recently we have been plagued with mosquitoes. My neighbor had one of these and recommended it to me. I ordered it and couldn’t wait for it to arrive. It is exactly what I need to keep the little biters at bay! I’ve worn it over two different hats: baseball cap and large sun hat. It works equally well with either one. Someone mentioned the holes were too large, however, I did not find that to be the case at all. I can see both large and small mosquitoes crawling on the netting, but they cannot get through.
customer_reviews.author: Kallippide

customer_reviews.title: Did its job in the wilderness
customer_reviews.text: I've never used a mosquito net before, but this became critical gear for my 5 day camping trip in Minnesota's Boundary Waters (BWCA). There was nothing more annoying than being a sitting target for mosquitos as I portaged a canoe on my shoulders, my hands occupied holding the canoe. I put this on and problem solved, was also a life saver at night as the mosqs started coming out. I've never used another net so I cannot compare. FYI, a local store where I went camping was selling another mosquito net for $6, but I did not have time to examine it. Amazon is not always cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Donny J

customer_reviews.title: Can go outside again!
customer_reviews.text: Gnats have been horrific this year making outdoor activity almost impossible. We're used all the sprays, etc. but nothing worked for long. This mesh net is outstanding and has made outside work possible again. It's light weight, easy to see through and covers the neck completely. I have ordered two more to have on hand at different places around our farm. We need one within reach anytime we go outside. Very pleased and highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: G McCabe

customer_reviews.title: A barrier between black flies and your face
customer_reviews.text: The black flies are terrible where I live and not even bug spray will keep them away for long. This net keeps every one of them off my face and head when I wear it over a sun visor. (Sun visor. That's how bad they are.) Plus it folds away into a little pouch. The visibility of the black one is great. I ran into a poor fellow madly swatting and attempting to spray away the black flies and he needed to know where I got this net. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Previously I tied a bandana across my mouth and ears to keep the bugs off while working outside. Unfortunately, it also made it very hard to breathe, and hard to see when the bandana was accidentally pushed up. The netting, even without a hat, was an immediate huge improvement. I could breathe, and see, and didn’t need cotton in my ears to keep the bugs out. The netting did a fantastic job of keeping out all but one or two very tiny bugs. Without the netting I was constantly fighting dozens of bugs all over my face. With the netting I could concentrate on getting the job done. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: gsc12345

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this. The black flies here in Massachusetts are awful, and I react quite badly to their bites. This saved me from having to repeatedly put tons of repellent chemicals on my face and neck throughout the day. It's very long, so I can tuck it into my shirt so the dirly bug(ger)s can't sneak under it. A friend of mine bought the same thing and we wear it over our riding helmets, too.
customer_reviews.author: AmyGrace

customer_reviews.title: How did I go in the woods without it?
customer_reviews.text: This is one the best purchases I have made for outdoor stuff from Amazon. I took this with me turkey hunting and not a single black fly or mosquito got to my face. They were out there and some landed on the netting, but they quickly gave up and moved on. Still use repellent, but this is a must have to go along with it. Visibility wise, after a few seconds you forget you are even wearing it. After 4 hours in the woods and getting back to my truck I forgot I was wering this until I went to take off my hat. It is that good to see through. Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: CHUCKTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Keeps Tiny Black Flies Out of My Eyes and Mosquitoes Out of My Ears.
customer_reviews.text: Yesterday, I was near the Appalachian Trail. Despite using an essential oil combination, the bugs were horrible. Out of desperation I placed this order from the woods. It arrived today. One day! Yay. The net comes in a neat little stuff sack. The sack and the net both contain a small spring loaded draw string. The net has ample room for any of my hats. Why didn't I order this long ago? Can't wait for the next hike. With this heat, the winged monsters will be out but I will be enjoying the trip. Great buy. If you too are bugged, order this now.
customer_reviews.author: foxbat

customer_reviews.title: Correcting Mistake!
customer_reviews.text: I mistakenly left a negative review about this item. The seller contacted me to let me know that I was reviewing netting and NOT a busted bottle....Sorry folks. Somehow, I ended up on the wrong page when I did the review and now I'll tell you what I think about THIS item:) It came as described, is light weight and it works well. It's easy to wear and we can see through it just fine. My husband and I do a lot of back country hiking and in the Spring and summer months the bugs are in our eyes, ears, and mouth...UGH! This netting at least keeps them out of those areas. Now....what to do about the rest of us???
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: OK but warm
customer_reviews.text: It does keep insects out and is easy to put over your hat. Plus it's an inexpensive option compared to nets attached to hats and you can use it with other hats you own. The only draw back is I did not think the mesh would retain as much heat around your head as it does. I think this would then be true with any mesh netting.
customer_reviews.author: Wisconsin Golfer

customer_reviews.title: I am amazed how well this works
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased this because of the black flies swarming my head while doing yard work and biting my ears, eyes, and hairline around my forehead. I am amazed how well this works! I spent a couple of days utilizing this and watched the flies swarm around my head and land in the netting but they were unable to bite me nor did they try to climb underneath the netting. I may be purchasing an upper body netting next for mosquito season....I despise using bug spray.
customer_reviews.author: i_never_tan

customer_reviews.title: Very Helpful
customer_reviews.text: We hiked in an area infested with mosquitoes. This head net was very effective to keep them out. And the draw tie around the opening was very helpful as well when we drew the tie around our foreheads and wore the net like a bit buffoon hat. And when it was sunny, I would over lap the excess netting to help shade my head.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Harry

customer_reviews.title: Very well made
customer_reviews.text: This is not a cheap net. I looked at less expensive nettings, but am glad that I spent a bit more and purchased two of these. The netting is a fine mesh, soft, and large enough to fit over a hat as in the picture. I like the cording used to be able to make the bottom size to your liking, another reason to spend a little more. There is a bag to store it in. We have not had a problem with wrinkles that another reviewer noted; we can see quite well-especially without those pesky gnats right in your face!
customer_reviews.author: Freckles

customer_reviews.title: I love this mosquito head net!
customer_reviews.text: This net is great and it comes in a cute little drawstring bag and brochure. I bought it for when I go in the backyard at night to spray large spider webs that I can find when it gets dark with a flashlight so I don't face plow into them in the morning when they are not so visible. I had been getting too many bites on my face and now I don't get any. The net works perfectly and problem solved. I'm sure I am going to find other uses for it as time goes on. It is made really well.
customer_reviews.author: The OC Gal

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly comfortable & good viz
customer_reviews.text: Was concerned size would be excessive but it’s perfect. Didn’t realize how claustrophobic my old net was till I got to enjoy this one. Netting is plenty soft and non-chafing. Visibility is great; for the most part I forget I’m wearing a net. Little pouch is cute but not sure I’ll use it as it’s handy to just leave netting over straw hat for next use. Was originally taken aback by that price but based on its comfort and performance I am thrilled with this purchase, may buy more for family members.
customer_reviews.author: Pilot Deep

customer_reviews.title: A good sized headnet
customer_reviews.text: This head net is full enough to fit over a hat, yet still has ample left to rest on your shoulders, so as to not leave any gaps for mosquitoes to find. As a stand-al;one headnet, it can be worn over hats, or just one one's head. It deters mosquitoes excellently. I've seen and heard them swarming my head, but can't reach me. The visibility through the net is excellent, and using means that I don't have to use bug repellent on my face, head, and neck. I bought two, so one can dry and freshen up while I wear the other. In this extended mosquito season, it is a godsend.
customer_reviews.author: GeraldD

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Mosquito Head Net!
customer_reviews.text: Finally, a mosquito head net with complete head/neck coverage! No worries about bugs sneaking under the net and feasting on me, especially when I treat the area that drapes on my shoulders etc. with a repellent spray. As an example of how good this head net is, my sister and I were both working outside one day. She remarked that the black flies were so bad, she had to run in and get some repellent spray on before they carried her away! She was totally shocked when I told her I didn't even notice any black flies!
customer_reviews.author: Marti

customer_reviews.title: Kept out the smallest of black flies
customer_reviews.text: I went fishing in the country where there was a lot of marsh area. The mosquitoes and black flies (gnats) were extremely heavy. I attempted to fish without the face net for a while, but waving your hand repeatedly in front of your face to dislodge flies really makes fishing difficult. Once I put the net on, the flies were no longer a nuisance. They would still fly around my face and occasionally land on the net, but with the small holes and my hat brim keeping the netting away from my face, I was bite free. This was a great option compared to having put deet based product on my face.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Kwong

customer_reviews.title: I recommend purchasing a bug repellant that is all natural derived ...
customer_reviews.text: Unless you apply some bug spray to your face, the Knats will still get through the net. Otherwise;the net masking is ok, however; I recommend purchasing a bug repellant that is all natural derived from a natural plant extracts and then place the Heat net over your head.
customer_reviews.author: SIMK

customer_reviews.title: It’s a mesh fabric net that’s fine enough to keep small bugs from getting through
customer_reviews.text: It’s a mesh fabric net that’s fine enough to keep small bugs from getting through. Looks to be very well constructed, and has a drawstring at the bottom that could pull tight enough to choke you out if so desired. The small stuff pouch that’s included is the bomb for storing it. Can’t wait to put it to the test and see those lil’ buggers try to get me now! Wasn’t so lucky on my last camp trip, without my bug net. I went back to work on Monday looking like I had measles. Don’t let that be you! Buy one of these nets.
customer_reviews.author: Doug M.

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: The netting is just as described. It is very roomy and draws up well with the attached drawstring. I was able to see through the netting very well. It was wonderful being able to take my walk without having to keep trying to fan the little gnats and mosquitoes away from my face and ears.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Fits even my very large head
customer_reviews.text: There are a very large number of companies selling head nets such as this one. I'vs owned three and this is my forth. The most significant difference I've found is size, especially diameter. I have a very large head (7 5/8-3/4 hat size, and face and neck to go with it). Some nets are so small the net presses against my nose and cheekbones. This net is large enough to hang loosely from my hat brim and not touch my face at all. BTW, if you have a smaller head this large net will still work nicely for you, just hang a bit looser. Otherwise the net seems well constructed and should last quite a while.
customer_reviews.author: Raven47

customer_reviews.title: Saved us from Black Flies!
customer_reviews.text: Our family had to drop our daughter off in the Adirondacks for a college class and we decided to make it a weekend trip. We found out it was the middle of black fly season and it was one of the worst years due to all the rain. I order four of the nets and got it on prime within the next couple of days. THANK GOODNESS! These nets helped save us from both black flies and mosquitoes without having to use toxic spray/creams on our face. But just a note: be sure to lift your net when eating toasted marshmallows--otherwise, you'll end up with a sticky net full of marshmallows and bugs that stick to it! :-)
customer_reviews.author: Bflochick

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a cruise on the Amazon river. I wore it during our night excursions in a small skiff along the shore where there A LOT of flying insects. I was afraid it might look ridiculous but everyone in my group was jealous. Function was much more important than fashion. The net was easy to see through and it was comfortable to wear.
customer_reviews.author: T. Morley

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift for the Gardener in Your Family
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item for my mother; she's an enthusiastic gardener, but the insects are equally enthusiastic about dining on her. Thus, the netting. It's quite roomy for any head smaller than a prize-winning pumpkin and the mesh is well-suited to keeping the insects away from my mother's earlobes, which seem to be the part of her that they find most delectable, yet it's simultaneously airy enough to be comfortable, even in the warm, muggy Illinois air. She's quite happy.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald MalcolmTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: By far the best on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: This head net is by far the best on Amazon and trust me I've bought many of them over the years. I live in Maine where blackflies are really bad. This net is much longer than most that you get on Amazon and even a little wider. Which means you get much better coverage and you can move your head around with a brimmed hat without opening on the bottom . I ordered another one as soon as I got This first one in the mail .
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Dave

customer_reviews.title: PREMIUM MOSQUITO HEAD NET by EVEN Naturals
customer_reviews.text: PREMIUM MOSQUITO HEAD NET by EVEN Naturals This product is well make and will fit over a sun hat with a wide brim, for those summer days that the black flies are a pain when mowing. It comes with its’ own storage bag which is also a quality product; not to mention a great little e-book that will for many add to your knowledge of natural products that defend against MOSQUITOs.
customer_reviews.author: J. W. Beene

customer_reviews.title: Works great.  Keeps the bugs away.
customer_reviews.text: These nets work great. Got one for myself and my brother. So much better than putting strong smelling repellents on my face. My brother didn't seem interested in it at first when I gave it to him, but I notice that he has been using it every time he mows around the trees out back and he admitted that he does like it! I wear mine when mowing in the evenings or walking my dog. Maybe doesn't look so great (although for me might be an improvement) but it works!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca C.

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: Should’ve returned item. Difficult to see through the green mesh. Doesn’t stay on your head real well due to the hat part not really fit in any size head.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: Best net for hardhats
customer_reviews.text: I love this net because it's large/long enough to fit over my hardhat without leaving a gaping hole around my neck. I bought extras of this style because the ones I find at the store are just too small, and I've been known to lose a net or two while hiking through thick brush. I can wear it down while taking notes in the field, and roll it up over the rim of my hardhat for easy breathing while I'm moving.
customer_reviews.author: Herz Suli

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: This is generously sized and sits well folded up on top of my hat until I need to use it. Definitely prevents those flying critters from getting near my face. I've had no problem with the dear little storage bag. I think as long as it's treated gently it can last a long time. I really recommend this for anybody who spends a lot of time outdoors in insect infested areas of the country.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Get the net's with 2 in a bag not these
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing wrong with this net at all. The price is to high and that is my fault. I thought I was buying a better quality net. I order 3 different ones. This a one a 2 pk. the was 7.98 and a 2 pk. with a hat included I think was 13.00 or 14.00 bucks. The other 2 were just a lot cheaper and I do like the one with the hats if you need that.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!!
customer_reviews.text: Comes with a nice little storage bag! Easy to use! Works great. I camp very near a river and all rivers have some flood areas (swamps). I like to fish that river and it was practically impossible with bugs swarming my face and eyes. Problem solved!! Works with a booney hat or a baseball cap. I would recommend using it with a hat. I am bald so they could probably bite me through the mesh if it was up against my skin.
customer_reviews.author: Marlo and Rich

customer_reviews.title: almost Perfect!!
customer_reviews.text: I used for walking my dogs. There are four 'hot spots' of bug attack along our walk. Now let's face it, not all bugs are the same size. The REALLY tiny ones still break in, but 99% are blocked. I know, because I can see them on the outside looking in (licking their fangs). But overall, very satisfied. Probably will order more some so I can always have one in close proximity for me and guests around the property.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable mosquito netting! You won’t regret this purchase!
customer_reviews.text: This is the most comfortable mosquito netting I have worn. I literally forget that I have it on. It is light, doesn’t make you hot and doesn’t reduce your vision. I immediately purchased another for my husband. We have a small farm and the gnats and flies can be relentless. I wear this over my hat and it makes working outside much more bearable. I am buying a couple more to have in had for friends who visit. For sizing, my husband has a pretty large hat over which he wears his net; it is a more snug fit that over my smaller hat, but it works.
customer_reviews.author: HoosierGator

customer_reviews.title: Not Effective for "No See'ems"
customer_reviews.text: This netting may work for mosquitos but it's not effective for gnats / "no See'ems".
customer_reviews.author: Risk Adjusted Return

customer_reviews.title: Great net
customer_reviews.text: This is the best head net I have found. The mesh is very lightweight and not so obnoxious to look through. It is big enough to go over most any hat you are wearing which I would recommend to keep the net aways from you face. Plus they are long so you can tuck it down in your shirt. They made evenings on a backpacking trip much more enjoyable keeping the bugs out of my face.
customer_reviews.author: Mike K

customer_reviews.title: It works for larger bugs too!
customer_reviews.text: I live in an area with lots of vicious deer flies. Already I cover up with denim long sleeves and pants to work in my yard...but they still bite and buzz around my face! I’ve knocked my glasses off swatting at them! Well, not anymore! I wore this net the first time the other day...WONDERFUL...not one fly in my face!! Even kept me from worrying about getting other spiders or bugs in my hair when mowing under trees!! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Corky

customer_reviews.title: Starting third year in regular summer use against the demonic Southwest Ga. GNATS
customer_reviews.text: I tried some of the hat/net combinations first but the nets were quickly torn so they became useless. This net is long enough on the shoulders to do the job. I am not one to be gentle with things but have not managed to poke a hole into it. And I like I can wear it over different hats, depending on which one I find first. Gnat season is just beginning so we will see if it survives another summer, but it has already proved to be well worth the money and has made my mowing and gardening 100% more enjoyable. Georgia gnats show no mercy and can run you back into the house quicker than anything!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Netting for the Money!
customer_reviews.text: This is the least amount of money I’ve ever paid for a product which is so invaluable when needed. I spent two weeks in Alaska fishing this summer. Alaska has relentless and vicious mosquitoes. They swarm you whether you have sprayed yourself or not. Your eyes, ears, nose and mouth are all fair game to them. This tiny piece of netting kept me comfortable in our campsites. The guys in my group had similar products but I’ll bet none of them paid so little. Great bargain!
customer_reviews.author: S.Amico

customer_reviews.title: It works well with a wide-brimmed hat
customer_reviews.text: We took them to our Alaska trip in early July. We camped at Wonder Lake, and there were enough mosquitoes around us so that we wore this mosquito head net most of the day. We put it on top of our wide-brimmed hat, and it did not bother us at all. Because it did not distract my view, I often forgot that I was wearing it (I tried to drink water/eat food with a head net on). Now that I am back home, I am using it when I go out to work on my garden. No more mosquito bites on my face!! It is well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: SY

customer_reviews.title: No Bug Bites Here!
customer_reviews.text: I've already bought two great double bed nets for my porch and now I have the premium mosquito head net so that I can work in my yard without being bitten by some nasty gnats! Thought I would feel ridiculous, but I feel liberated and thrilled to be able to be outside after 4pm in my yard! Thanks EVEN Naturals...once again! And I love that I can put it back in the little bag it came in so I can bring it with me where ever I go...
customer_reviews.author: 1ZenCowgirl

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this product. Gnat season just began here and my husband is highly allergic. His old net was too short. These are keeping him safe when he gardens and mows. I like that it fits over a big hat. After I saw his and he tried it out, I ordered one for myself. There has been times when we went out in the country and couldn't even get out of the car because gnats were thick in the air. So, we keep one in the car. The little drawstring bag is so helpful. I can easily keep my net in my purse.
customer_reviews.author: JCD

customer_reviews.title: NO CARE in packaging
customer_reviews.text: I can NOT believe how this was packaged!!!!! I do not know how it even made it through the mail without being lost. The package had three items in it and the cardboard edges on the package were just folded inside. They did NOT even tape or seal the edges. The package was a little crushed so not sure how the items being so tiny didn't slip out or someone could have lifted up one of the flaps and helped themselves. The product seems ok. We will be using it this summer hope it works for mosquitoes. But who ever packaged this did not care about their product reaching us. There was no care in packaging!!
customer_reviews.author: dj

customer_reviews.title: Good fit and function.
customer_reviews.text: Fits around my hat fine and I can see through it fine since it is black. It also tightens around your neck to keep fly ups away. You do need a hat with a rim all the way around for the best use or as other reviewers have done double up on these. I am taking this to boundry waters to prevent some harrasment from bugs when we are going.
customer_reviews.author: Dan DurigTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: I think this will be a good protector if the matrix pattern is small enough to keep out the gnats
customer_reviews.text: I just received this today and haven't had a chance to field test it but trying it on makes me believe it will be a good protector from the bugs, it fits low enough in the front and back and the closure tightens to form a good seal, of course out in the field will really tell so I will have to update. update 7-14-2018 I've found this head net has pores too large, it protects from mosquitoes but the biting gnats will get in, too bad. I like the extra length, the adjustable cord closure.
customer_reviews.author: sgrams

customer_reviews.title: Keep the Gnats away.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a gift for hunting on a West Texas ranch. Hey, these really work, in the Spring the gnats are terrible. It's either this or a bandanna that doesn't cover your eyes, this is better.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Yanker

customer_reviews.title: this definitely saved me and would absolutely recommend. It turned what could have been an annoying ...
customer_reviews.text: this definitely saved me and would absolutely recommend. It turned what could have been an annoying disastrous backpacking trip to just a slight annoyance from all the gnats and mosquitoes that made it their life’s purpose to fly into your ears, nose, eyes and mouth. I will never get use to use to the loud buzzing cloud that would engulf me during my backpacking trips
customer_reviews.author: RAngeles

customer_reviews.title: The unsung hero of hiking trips
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought this for me last year and after I used it several times during recent hikes in Yosemite on very buggy trails, he just bought one for himself. Do I look slightly ridiculous while hiking?.. Yes, but I am so much more comfortable if it's a hike with mosquitos or annoying gnats that only want to fly straight into your eyes, ears, nose and mouth. I don't use this often but when I do, I'm reminded of how glorious it is ;) It is a coveted hiking staple I keep in my pack for bug emergencies.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It does the job!
customer_reviews.text: My wife, tender little thing she is, loves gardening, but was faced with the worst gnat infested spring in memory. Her reaction to the little beasties was intense swelling and itching from bites. This simple netting fit perfectly over her favorite gardening hat, and tucked away snugly under her long-sleeved shirt. No bites, no swelling, and lots of flowers and veggies put into her garden. Couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.author: Hatsuda

customer_reviews.title: It kept the "No See 'Em's" from biting me!
customer_reviews.text: I seem to be a biting bug magnet this year and am tired of masses of itchy welts. What a nice surprise to be able to weed whack without being constantly bit on my face, neck and head. I used the net over a baseball cap and it fit very well. It was also long with both an elasticized bottom and a draw string. I could see the bugs swarming but none got in. Yahoo!
customer_reviews.author: Wifey

customer_reviews.title: Well Made and Great Cover
customer_reviews.text: I first purchased a mosquito head net at a local store and found it was not big enough to fit over my had and completely cover my neck. Decided to check out Amazon and found this mosquito head net. It works very well over my hat and completely covers my neck. It is easy to see through and came I a small bag for storage. Very happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Marial

customer_reviews.title: This will certainly do!
customer_reviews.text: Headed out on a camping trip in a few weeks and this was one of the last things on my list. After seeing quite a few options and reading many reviews for head nets I decided to spend the couple extra dollars for this one. Qualtiy is very nice, its longer than many of the others i looked at but mainly I love it because it fits my wide brim Brixton rancher hat. Very excited to put it to use! Comes with a nifty little back with a toggle to keep it in would reccomend.
customer_reviews.author: Bichenbrunette

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use during my daily morning hikes in the worst few weeks of deer fly season. It did the job, was easy to carry in my pocket until I needed it, and was light and comfortable enough to wear over a baseball cap. I thought it might be flimsy at this price point, but it's held together well so far (about 30 uses now).
customer_reviews.author: nhsatomom

customer_reviews.title: See You Later Skeeter
customer_reviews.text: I was in my garden, attempting to do some minor gardening (without the Mosquito Head Net Mesh) when the pesky flyers spied fresh meat(me). While under attack, I managed to run into the safety of my house, grabbed the product out of it's packaging and get it over my baseball cap and head. Full of confidence, I strolled back outside and finished my task bite free!
customer_reviews.author: H. Boykin

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Was in Iceland and there are parts of the country that have annoying bugs. I am totally bug-phobic. This worked like a charm. I could not have been happier. put it over a sun/safari hat and it worked great. the netting is very tiny and that does make a difference when you have super small bugs. Not one got in. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Simple product for a major problem..
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had a opportunity to use it yet, but I've tried it on and it fits perfectly over my gardening hat. I purchased this particular one because it appeared to be larger than some of the other ones on Amazon. I live in South Florida and will using it on my evening walks, as well as gardening.
customer_reviews.author: bdb

customer_reviews.title: Not as big as I hoped
customer_reviews.text: The headline says Ultra Large. This item is by no means Ultra Large. It doesn't even fit over my brimmed hat easily. I am going to return. The headline is not correct.
customer_reviews.author: Amazoncustomer

customer_reviews.title: Great for gardening and hiking!
customer_reviews.text: I was gardening and the mosquitoes were flying all over my face. I thought now is the time to use my new mosquito net. I put it on over my hat and had an easy time gardening. The mosquitoes flew around my face and landed on my net but I was free from any mosquito bites or annoyance. Highly recommend this net and will use it all the time when gardening or hiking!
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: This is a life saver!
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I needed to be able to go for walks at this time of the year where mosquitoes and deer flies attack me. Now I just laugh at them. I did buy a wide brimmed hat like they suggested and it works great. Highly recommended if you need protection from annoying flying pests!
customer_reviews.author: Ian Currie

customer_reviews.title: VERY USEFUL HEAD NET
customer_reviews.text: This is a great net. I live in Georgia, full of gnats and mosquitos and the like. If you keep them away from your head, they seem to stay off the rest of your body too. Very interesting experience for me anyway. My husband likes it too for mowing. It helps keep the flying objects away from your face.
customer_reviews.author: nip

customer_reviews.title: Worth their weight in gold!
customer_reviews.text: These nets saved our skins, literally, during our recent trip to Iceland. The nets are super lightweight, quick and easy to deploy, comfortable, and easy to see through. Not a single mosquito was able to penetrate the nets. Essential item for hiking or camping trips, or just summers in general, in northerly areas.
customer_reviews.author: Kitty Kat

customer_reviews.title: Best Bug Net I Have Ever Had
customer_reviews.text: The mesh is so fine that I forget I am wearing it. Especially when I spit sometimes. The large one is it, next to the kind I had been wearing. It has a nice drawstring at the bottom but since it is so long it just drapes around you so well that the letters have never gotten inside. You wear this over a wide-brimmed hat.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Murro

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly in Australia’s Outback
customer_reviews.text: It worked perfectly in the Outback. It is bigger than the nets most of my travel mates were using, so it was easier to use with a brimmed hat and easier to take off and on. The other reason it works better than most nets is that its mesh is black, so colors are not distorted. It is sturdy, and easily stuffs into its little sack. A terrific head net.
customer_reviews.author: seniormomentnw

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, Functional, & Attractive
customer_reviews.text: This head net does the job perfectly for warm weather gardening & walks. I wear it with a soft brim cotton hat, and it seems it would work well with any brimmed hat. It keeps the bugs off beautifully, is easy to see through, and even looks elegant. I especially appreciate the way it drapes down & around. A ++
customer_reviews.author: clarabel

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the biting insects away from head and neck
customer_reviews.text: I have a very wide brim hat to keep the sun off my head and neck. I was pleased when I was able to put the mosquito head net over the hat with plenty of room for to extend down to my neck. Besides keeping mosquitoes from biting, this year we have an abundance of tiny biting flies (midges) and this net is keeping them out.
customer_reviews.author: Tech Writer

customer_reviews.title: Kept the mosquitos away
customer_reviews.text: I used this in a five-night, summer trip in the Boundary Waters and used it each night and even a few times on portages through the woods during the day. If you plan to wear a hat already, this is a great net. It held up fine throughout the trip. I did treat it with permethrin prior, which probably helped too.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Don't be a sad sack - put a gnat sack in your knapsack!
customer_reviews.text: I spent forty-six years shooing flies away from my face, but no longer. I hike in the woods almost every day with my dog, and this keeps the gnats, mosquitoes, flies, midges, and no-see-ums at bay. I regret every moment of my life spent without this gnat sack. I've gone from bumpy and itchy to footloose and fancy free.
customer_reviews.author: Weasel

customer_reviews.title: Freedom from bug bites to the face !
customer_reviews.text: I am an avid gardener on the eastern shore of Maryland and the mosquitos and no-see-ums are brutal. I also have very sensitive skin so even the gentlest bug spray is extremely irritating. I used your net the same day it arrived and was thrilled to be able to garden without chemicals on my face. The quality of your netting is really obvious from the moment you put it on. It is lightweight, and covers everything to my shoulders. I immediately ordered a second one. I appreciate the craftsmanship you devoted to your product.
customer_reviews.author: Mary ann Sewell

customer_reviews.title: Keeps bugs off
customer_reviews.text: I walk in the woods during the summer and this is an excellent accessory for keeping off mosquitoes and flies. It comes packaged in a nice little pouch which I use to store it away for the winter. I got it caught on branches several times and it didn't rip. What a relief!
customer_reviews.author: Peregin

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Keeps the tiny flies and gnats off your face
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. I was looking at the hat mounted nets that come with the hat I wanted to use it with my existing baseball hats It works great! Put on the hat and the net on top. I love the draw string at the base. Keeps the little buggers away and lets you do your work.
customer_reviews.author: brivision

customer_reviews.title: Great Alternative to Bug Spray
customer_reviews.text: This is a great alternative to bug spray! It's exactly what I was hoping for. It keeps the mosquitos and other annoying flying insects off my face. It comes with a nice little pouch. The pouch isn't very big, but it's great for keeping in a nook of the car or backpack when the bugs aren't out. It also came with a nice little ebook on the mosquitos that most of us are trying to avoid. I'm entirely satisfied with this product and recommend it to anyone that wants to keep bugs off their face.
customer_reviews.author: Windsor Rick

customer_reviews.title: Get this one!
customer_reviews.text: I received my Mosquito Head Net the other day. Bugs and mosquitoes are already out. Not one bite or even any bothering me. I was working in a heavily wooded swampy area. I love the construction. Very well thought out and a great value. When I work I am pretty rough on my clothing, so I am sure you get additional orders from me.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Woodward

customer_reviews.title: I have joined the silly looking people
customer_reviews.text: I have joined the silly looking people, but at least I don't have gnats flying in my ears, nose, eyes, and mouth every few seconds anymore. So far, this has allowed me to keep my sanity on the heavy bug days. I plan on getting some more as spares.
customer_reviews.author: Roadmaster

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't come with hat.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a safari style hat to go with it. Stays off my face and neck so nothing can touch my face through the net, keeps bugs and large debris out. Easier to see through than it looks. (PS Dark Colors are better for nets that you have to look through, lighter colors reflect the light.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B

customer_reviews.title: Good enough product, and it works, but I wish...
customer_reviews.text: This is a good enough product and I would say to buy it. What I wish for is that it was wide enough at the bottom to go over the shoulders when I am in the pool. I also wish that it was white.
customer_reviews.author: G. S. Harris

customer_reviews.title: No more buggers
customer_reviews.text: Great product - no hole on top, tiny holes don't hamper vision, shock cord with cord lock on bottom, easily fits over a boonie or baseball cap with still enough length to tuck in - better than pictured and described - little pricey, but buy once cry once
customer_reviews.author: ruski3:16

customer_reviews.title: It Works
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Keeps the bugs out, but lets the air in. After awhile I'm not aware I'm wearing it, except when i see mosquitoes hovering around, but can't get in. I also spray my net with not poisonous, organic bug repellent made from essential oils.
customer_reviews.author: Robert E. Long Jr.

customer_reviews.title: fits over a widebrimmed Sloggers hat
customer_reviews.text: I like this net because it fits over a wide brimmed garden hat by Sloggers and doesn't have elastic at the bottom and instead a comfortable drawstring. My last net had elastic and it was super itchy and I had to wear it under a hat rather than over.
customer_reviews.author: Zoo

customer_reviews.title: It works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: I used this head net in the upper peninsula of Michigan. There were areas where the biting flies were unavoidable. They swarmed me despite using 100% deet and clothes that had been protected with permathrin. I actually got one fly bite through my sock. I was glad I was wearing the head net when the flies were swarming. The head net came with a nice storage bag too.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Worlton

customer_reviews.title: Saved my summer
customer_reviews.text: This netting did a great job keeping the hordes of gnats out of my eyes while I did yard work. The mesh is fine, easy to see through and kept everything out. The length was nice for protecting my neck. Neighbors were envious and asked where I bought it. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: V. M. Sebestyen

customer_reviews.title: Best headnet for backpacking
customer_reviews.text: This is the best headnet I’ve owned. Over the years I’ve had 4-5 different ones, this one is lighter, larger and better fitting, and more transparent to look through than all of them, including Sea to Summit, Outdoor Research hoop model, Ben’s and military surplus versions. I recommend this one to my friends and I keep 2 spares to loan out. I have 4 of these and will buy more.
customer_reviews.author: lapeters

customer_reviews.title: Better length
customer_reviews.text: This head net is about 4" longer than the comparable Sea to Summit product which left gaps between its bottom and my shirt. This one provides a much better fit for me since I wear this netting with a wide-brimmed hat. Seems like it will give better protection.
customer_reviews.author: jmaurelius

customer_reviews.title: Still Good But Fabric Is Harsh
customer_reviews.text: I like the size and ease of use. However, I have ordered this netting in the past and it was much softer. Now the fabric is harsh even after washing.
customer_reviews.author: Susan E.

customer_reviews.title: The quality is great and I like the bag
customer_reviews.text: The quality is great and I like the bag...easy to replace the netting. Overall...its easy to use...comfortable...good visibility when worn, best when worn with a wide brimmed hat I fly radio controlled model airplanes...and the gnats/mosquitos can be quite bothersome when trying to concentrate on flying...the netting does not impair the visibility so that is much appreciated...not to mention...no gnats in my ears,nose,mouth
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Probably fine but mine was torn. Updated
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to use in the field but it had a rip ok the top that became exasperated while I was working. Sadly I returned home too late to return the item. UPDATE: The seller contacted me and was extremely sweet. I'm sure my issue isn't the norm so I changed my review.
customer_reviews.author: KMSB

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: This was a great easy-to-use product. I used it in Africa while on a safari to keep the mosquitoes and tsetse flies away. After use, it fits back into the pouch easily. The only think that would be nicer is if it were white instead of black.
customer_reviews.author: LifeGirl

customer_reviews.title: overpriced
customer_reviews.text: this thing is just a bit of cheap mesh. don't know why it had to be 8 dollars. also it's not as big as it appears in the picture.
customer_reviews.author: LS

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the mosquitoes at bay
customer_reviews.text: I wore this on a 10 night canoe trip in the Canadian wilderness with my son and his Boy Scout crew. We didn't need it all the time, but it came in handy during some of the portages when the mosquitoes would swarm pretty fiercely. When not in use it balls up pretty small in an included bag slighly larger than a ping-pong ball and fit in a front pocket pretty easily. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Preston P. Dubose

customer_reviews.title: There are better deals out there
customer_reviews.text: Works fine, but there are better deals out there for this price. The storage pouch ripped like nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Roman

customer_reviews.title: Get one. End of story.
customer_reviews.text: Wasps have taken over my second car. I couldn't work on it without getting stung. The finer mesh is really nice to have because of all the baby wasps. Nice pouch to keep me from losing it. This will go in the glove box, as I am also an occassional fisherman.
customer_reviews.author: BobbyB

customer_reviews.title: ... motorcycle trip to alaska but looking at the item pretty much insures it is exactly what i was looking ...
customer_reviews.text: wont be using item until this fall on my motorcycle trip to alaska but looking at the item pretty much insures it is exactly what i was looking for. netting is a very fine mesh to keep out the smallest pest but is easy to see thru. i wanted a net with enough length to cover my neck area and this item does that, plus the draw string helps keep it secure. worn with a wide brim hat i have no doubt this will perform as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: EVEN Naturals Premium Mosquito Head Net Mesh, Ultra Large, Extra Fine Holes, Insect Netting, Bug Face Shield, Soft Durable Fly Screen, Protection for no See um Midges Gnats, Carry Bag, Chemical Free
feature_bullets: SIMPLY THE BEST MOSQUITO HEAD NET: This Mosquito Net is BIGGER than other nets. To protect you - even against midges, gnats and no-see-ums - it has the FINEST mesh, the only head net with 620 holes/inch2. And it provides fresh air. It offers GREAT visibility and is made of premium materials. Don’t be fooled by lower prices that compromise quality. You and your family deserve the best protection, choose the market leader EVEN Naturals.

PERFECT FIT: The size (top C 25” x height 26" x bottom C 39”) fits comfortable over most headwear (hat NOT included). We assume you like wearing your own favorite hat or cap underneath. This size - EXTRA LONG - and shape are the best in terms of protection, comfort and ease of use. The premium quality elastic DRAWSTRING & TOGGLE makes it even more simple to put it on and off.

NATURAL WAY: This Head Net gives you great protection against insects and related diseases. No bug spray like DEET on your face and neck. The fabric serves as a natural mosquito protection. Not treated with chemicals. Proper air circulation. Also a great help while traveling, to keep you safe! Machine washable.

MUST-HAVE FOR ANY OUTDOOR LOVER: This Mosquito Net keeps you from being eaten alive! Customers say: ‘I am prone to insect bites allergies, so this is a lifesaver’ - ‘I want the best and Even Naturals is number 1 in mosquito nets. I trust them’. The carry bag makes it a great GIFT for any traveler, hiker, gardener, hunter, fisherman.
